text: I have a fun idea it's another muffin
cup idea its tortilla cups filled with
yogurt and berries for breakfast I think
you're gonna like it because well who
wouldn't want to have an edible tortilla
cup for their yogurt in the morning
first you have to start off by making
your tortilla cups brush six flour
tortillas with unsalted butter 2
tablespoons total for the six tortillas
and you want to brush both sides of each
tortilla I'm gonna do this this way
brush it sprinkle turn so sprinkle them
with sugar wanna sprinkle both sides
with sugar as well it's two tablespoons
of sugar get your oven preheating to 375
degrees and you are gonna need jumbo
muffin tins for this if you don't have
jumbo muffin tins well I guess you could
make really super tiny ones but that you
wouldn't get much yogurt in there so
you're just gonna lay them on top
overlapping they're not exactly pliable
yet and you want them to get pliable so
you're gonna overlap them on top of the
muffin tin and then put them in the oven
for a couple of minutes they'll get
pliable and then you can push them in so
375 for about two minutes just till they
get soft okay so these are already
starting to wilt into the pan so you
just press them in with a glass so to
get them centered so that they're
relatively even but it's not a huge big
deal if they're not and they form a
little cup right away don't leave them
in too long because then the edges start
to set and it could crack when you try
to press them into the tins which think
I might have left mine in a minute too
long two minutes guys two minutes set a
timer you could put a little bit of
cinnamon in with the sugar if you want
to and then these would be cinnamon
sugar cops for your yogurt back into the
oven you want to get them crisp and let
them set that'll take about 12 more
minutes
now you get to fill them and I'm gonna
use lightly sweetened yogurt so take one
and a half cups of plain yogurt and then
add two tablespoons of sugar I think
that this is so much better than the pre
sweetened ones you get to control how
much sweetness you're adding you can add
none if you want to especially since
you're gonna lightly sweetened the fruit
that goes on top it's not necessary to
sweeten your yogurt for the fruit you
want a combination of like one and a
half cups total of fruit you can use
berries you can use nectarines you can
use peaches a little bit of sugar it's
another tablespoon of brown sugar a
little bit of lemon juice about teaspoon
and a half of lemon juice
some peach whatever's in season this is
the kind of thing that you can use
whatever fruit you want your favorite
fruit all berries all stone fruit
cherries are my one of my favorites but
you do have to pick them which is kind
of annoying you have to pick peaches too
but there's only one pit in a peach
there's a pit in every single cherry
it's nice it's nice and juicy just don't
use anything that's not in season or
doesn't taste good because what a waste
right cut them in half just because my
muffin cups aren't that big I want to be
able to fit some fruit in there into
your bowl with the rest of your berries
and then I also have a little bit of
blackberries you can add some of those
blackberries
give it a stir your fruit is super sweet
you don't even need any sweetener in
here time to eat look at that cute place
isn't it adorable spoon your yogurt into
your cup the cups can be made ahead the
yogurt can be made ahead the fruit salad
can be made ahead but I'd wait probably
till you're close to serving it before
you fill it cuz I don't think you want
your cup to get soggy right add some
fruit not fun I kind of love it
what a fun and unique way to serve your
yogurt in the morning don't you think
and delicious
you
